intro: Languas kelungensis, commonly known as the Kelungensis Languas, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
